content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates.
- Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the delivery belt.
- Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers extracted ore.
- Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Stores the extracted ore.
- Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore to a remote branch.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Transfers ore on the intermediate belt.
- Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Receives ore from the remote inserter.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) – Smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
- Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) – Processes science packs.
- Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5) – Draws water from resource at (-9.0, 25.0).
- Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5) – Converts water into steam.
- Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) – Generates electricity.
- Electricity Network comprising:
  • Small Electric Pole (position: 2.5, 2.5)
  • Small Electric Pole (position: 3.5, 2.5)
  • Small Electric Pole (position: 4.5, 3.5)
  • Small Electric Pole (position: 6.5, 0.5)
- Pipe Connection:
  • Offshore Pump connected to Boiler via a PipeGroup (fluid_system=202 at position: 2.5, 19.5; status: WORKING).

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
- Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) – Configured for pipe crafting; currently reports NO_POWER and, after recent updates, only the “not receiving electricity” warning remains.
- Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores crafted Pipes.
- Electricity Network comprising:
  • Original Small Electric Poles at positions (2.5, 2.5), (3.5, 2.5), (4.5, 3.5), (6.5, 0.5)
  • Additional poles added in recent steps:
  – Pole at (5.5, 0.5) from Step 160
  – Pole at (3.5, -2.5) from Step 162
  – Pole at (3.5, -1.5) from Step 166
  • Note: Attempts to place poles at (3.5, 1.5) and (2.5, 1.5) were unsuccessful due to inventory shortages or spatial conflicts.

ERROR TIPS
──────────────────────
• Pipe Crafting Resource Management
  - Confirm that a sufficient supply of iron plates is available before initiating pipe production; verify outputs from furnaces and storage inventories.

• Electrical Network Delivery for Production Facilities
  - Ensure production assemblers receive proper power by checking the configuration and merging of electric pole networks. If persistent “not receiving electricity” warnings occur even after adding poles, reassess connection sequences and network integration.

• Electric Pole Placement and Connection
  - When errors occur during electric pole placement, verify that:
    ▪ The inventory contains the required small electric poles before placement.
    ▪ The target location is free of obstructions—errors citing “no small_electric_pole in inventory” or “existing object in the way” indicate a need for inventory checks and choosing an unoccupied position.
  - Address connection errors such as “name ‘fixed_pole’ is not defined” by ensuring proper variable declarations or using an appropriate reference for the pole being placed.

• General Resource and Connection Verification
  - Regularly audit inventory and connection statuses to preempt resource shortages and misconfigurations.

NAMESPACE
──────────────────────
(No functions have been defined by the agent.)
